block.p: Sandra Ann Urie and Frank Farnum Herron were married last evening at the Massachusetts Horticultural Society in Wellesley. The Rev. J. Philip Zaeder, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

Ms. Urie, 54, is keeping her name. She is the president and chief executive of Cambridge Associates, an investment consulting firm in Boston. She graduated from Stanford and received a master's degree in public and private management from Yale. She is a board member of the Phillips Academy in Andover, Mass.
Sandra Ann Urie and Frank Farnum Herron were married last evening at the Massachusetts Horticultural Society in Wellesley. The Rev. J. Philip Zaeder, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.
Sandra Ann Urie and Frank Farnum Herron were married last evening at the Massachusetts Horticultural Society in Wellesley. The Rev. J. Philip Zaeder, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

Ms. Urie, 54, is keeping her name. She is the president and chief executive of Cambridge Associates, an investment consulting firm in Boston. She graduated from Stanford and received a master's degree in public and private management from Yale. She is a board member of the Phillips Academy in Andover, Mass.
She is a daughter of Richard Urie of Peabody, Mass., and the late Marion Urie.

Mr. Herron, also 54, was until February a staff writer for arts and culture at The Post-Standard newspaper in Syracuse, where he worked for 18 years. He graduated from Cornell and is a candidate for a master's degree in media studies from Syracuse University.
He is a son of John Herron of Worcester, Mass., and the late Frances Herron.
